page.title: 02COMMUTING FROM PETTS WOOD
page.content: 25 000 season tickets are sold each year at {Petts Wood Station}. Fifty eight trains pass through each hour during the "rush hour". There are 8 - 10 carriages in each train with 80 seats in each carriage. Many extra people crowd into each carriage and stand all the way to London. Trains travel up to {Charing Cross}, {Victoria} and {Cannon Street} therefore office workers, civil servants and newspaper workers find {Petts Wood} a convenient place to live. People who travel long distances every morning to get to work and every evening to get home are known as {commuters}. The trains which take them into the city are called commuter trains.
